intro: Antimima buchubergensis, commonly known as the Buchberg mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Antimima buchubergensis is often found in rocky outcrops and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny environments.
